parameters.definition: Number of apartments a new model furnace can heat
Daily energy consumption of a new model furnace
Number of apartments an old model furnace can heat
Daily energy consumption of an old model furnace
Maximum proportion of old model furnaces
Minimum number of new model furnaces to be used
Minimum number of apartments to be heated

description: A high rise building is buying two types of furnaces, a new model and an old model. A new model furnace can heat \param{HeatNew} apartments and consumes \param{EnergyNew} kWh per day. An old model can heat \param{HeatOld} apartments and consumes \param{EnergyOld} kWh per day. Since the old model is harder to find, at most \param{MaxOldProp} of the furnaces can be the old model and at least \param{MinNew} new model furnaces should be used. If the high rise needs to heat at least \param{MinApartments} apartments and has \param{MaxEnergy} kWh of electricity available, how many of each furnace should be purchased to minimize the total number of furnaces?
